front.title: SIP for Telephones (SIP-T): Context and Architectures

abstract.t: SIP-T (earlier referred to as the SIP-BCP-T) is a mechanism that uses SIP to facilitate the interconnection of the PSTN with IP. This document explains the context and the architectures in which SIP-T may be used. This document has to be studied in conjunction with the existing SIP-T (referred to in some older documents as SIP-BCP-T) literature.
